title: Homeless on the Cape, no lifeline in sight
content: My oldest son and I have been homeless for over 1½ years, staying on friends’ couches. I’ve been on the housing waiting list and Section 8 waiting list since I was divorced in 1993. I’ve always kept both places notified of my addresses as they’ve changed. I’ve been filling out applications for places to live for some time now. My questions are: 1) How can you get a housing certificate or Section 8 voucher when you don’t have custody of your child/children? 2) How is it that my name keeps on falling through the cracks for a housing certificate and/or Section 8 voucher? 3) Why can’'t my son and I get any housing help? I have been denied Social Security disability for two years now and finally decided to go directly for a hearing, which I got for this October. I suffer from diabetes, high blood pressure, neuropathy of my feet and hands, arthritis, ongoing back problems and fibromyalgia. I’m not looking for something for free. I’m just looking for some help. I’ve lived on Cape Cod all my life and never have I struggled to have a place to live and call it my home. Beth Linnell Cape Cod
